text: Albania competed at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships in Gwangju, South Korea from 12 to 28 July. ==Swimming== Albania entered four swimmers. ;Men {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left rowspan=2|Françi Aleksi |align=left|400 m freestyle |4:07.39 |44 |colspan=2 |colspan=2|Did not advance |- |align=left|800 m freestyle |8:33.54 |37 |colspan=2 |colspan=2|Did not advance |- |align=left rowspan=2|Kledi Kadiu |align=left|100 m freestyle |52.53 |=80 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|200 m freestyle |1:55.11 |57 |colspan=4|Did not advance |} ;Women {| class="wikitable" style="text- align:center; font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font- size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left rowspan=2|Nikol Merizaj |align=left|50 m freestyle |27.40 |54 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|100 m freestyle |59.60 |57 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left rowspan=2|Katie Rock |align=left|100 m butterfly |1:07.85 |46 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|200 m butterfly |2:28.58 |31 |colspan=4|Did not advance |} ==References== Category:Nations at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships Category:Albania at the World Aquatics Championships Category:2019 in Albanian sport
